name: JW Marriott Las Vegas Resort, Spa & Golf

reviews.text: I love Mandalay Bay, I think the rooms and restaurants and The Venetian are great, and have always found the Monte Carlo to be a steal with its clean rooms and atmosphere.
reviews.title: 7-7-7 ... it's a winner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You’re not going to get the “Vegas” experience at the JW Marriott … and that’s a great thing!
reviews.title: Worthy of Rave Reviews

likes.disliked: — There was some smoke in the casino

reviews.text: This resort is one that you’ll want to tell your friends about. Great spot for a family stay. Oversized rooms with walk-in closets, oversized bathrooms with spa tubs and rainfall showerheads – and those are the standard rooms.
reviews.title: Better than staying on The Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice pool – salt-water, I think – with a lap-swimming straight section and a larger, free-form area. There’s a lifeguard on hand to keep an eye on the little ones. (We even hired one to babysit for us that evening so we could sneak down to the casino for a couple of hours.)
reviews.title: Best hotel I have ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good locals-oriented casino on the property, with lots of small demonination machines. Few blackjack and gaming tables; however, many of them offered single-deck 21, if that’s your thing. The casino 24-hour restaurant is pretty good, but their restaurant row still had some vacancies.
reviews.title: A dream

likes.liked: — Location and easy access to other facilities

reviews.title: Gorgeous resort
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 wonderful nights in July. The room was beautiful. Customer service was great. The pool is beautiful with water falls. I definately recommend this hotel. Quick drive to the strip or take the hotels free shuttle. I spent last part of the trip at the Venetian. Will definately stay at the JW if I have a chance again.

...I do have a few minor complaints, which I will proceed to list before elaborating upon all the good qualities of the JW. First, where were the washcloths? None in the room, none at the spa. I could've used one to scrub away the stench of smoke from the adjacent Rampart Casino (REALLY smokey, even for a casino). Second, in the gym at the spa, there are no mirrors in the workout area, which makes weight-lifting a little more difficult. Also, the spa facilities, which are nice enough, don't compare with the spas at Mandalay Bay or the Bellagio.
reviews.title: A Great Resort But...

reviews.text: The room at the JW was great. It was more than large enough to accomodate the rollaway we requested which was delivered promptly and politely. The queen beds were very comfortable - some of the best hotel beds, comparable to Westin's heavenly bed, and better than the beds at The Bellagio, Venetian, MGM, et al. The mattress was the perfect firmness and the duvet and pillows were fluffy and comfortable. The bathroom was out of this world. In a city with numerous hotels boasting grand bathrooms, this one trumps them all. The jacuzzi tub easily accommodated two people, and the rainfall shower was very relaxing. Double-sinks and a separate room for the toilet made sharing the bathroom with four other people a little easier. Also, the faux balcony was a nice added bonus to an already terrific room. The whole room felt newly refurbished and showed no signs of wear, and the decor was understated and inviting.
reviews.title: J.W. Marriott is Top Flight Hotel

reviews.text: The pool area was easily accessed from the Spa Tower (where our room was located), and we were not forced to walk through the casino or a shopping promenade in our bathing suits. There were enough lounges for anyone who wanted one, and poolside food and drink service was friendly (not prompt, though our waitness apologized numerous times for the kitchen being backed up, and she did not get flustered when it took us a long time to order because some of us were on the other side of the pool). The pool water was unusually salty, but was cool and refreshing nonetheless.
reviews.title: Gorgeous spot for a wedding!!!!!

reviews.text: All in all, it was a very nice trip. The hotel is VERY calm and quiet - seemingly the antithesis of Las Vegas. We utilized the shuttle service a few times, but it would've been better if they had one later shuttle returning to the hotel, at least on weekends (11:30pm is the latest returning shuttle). Getting to and from the strip was not a problem, though a bit more action and better people-watching within walking distance (much better eye-candy at Mandalay, Bellagio, Hard Rock) would've been nice. Still, for the service, room, and pool, I highly recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Great time at the JW
Fabulous
reviews.text: We stayed at the JW Marriott Las Vegas for 4 nights. Managed to get a 560 sq ft double room (they call this "standard"!) for $179/nt thanks to a leisure promotion on the company's website.

reviews.title: Loved The JW
reviews.text: Let me tell you, I've stayed in MANY hotels around the world, and this is one of the very best.

Excellent room-- so many amenities and little touches (like a double sink, whirlpool spa, amazing shower.. and the ability to turn up the TV volume in the bathroom!) and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in (and I have "memory foam" and egyptian cotton at home, so I don't say that lightly!).
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Awesome staff-- check-in was a breeze, complimentary waters every time we visited the desk, completely professional and very attentive to our needs. Arranging a late check-out wasn't a problem... they made everything so easy.
reviews.title: Terrific stay at JW Marriott Las Vegas - Highly Recommended

likes.liked: — The room was great, service was superb, and the setting/grounds were lovely.
likes.disliked: — I have no negatives to offer - it was a wonderful place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great food-- I wasn't expecting much from casino restaurants, but the food at the Promenade cafe (24 hr, downstairs) was excellent, and very reasonably priced. $10 buys a very nice meal.
reviews.title: Hmmm... not sure this warrants all the over the top reviews
Wow! What else can I say
reviews.text: AWESOME! Large rooms, upscale amenities, and large bathroom. Jacuzzi too! But it's not Vegas! It's not on the strip, it's not in the same hemisphere. If you like vacationing in the desert go! It's great. Like Palm Springs!!! If you like Vegas, stay elsewhere!

Wonderful, wonderful hotel. An oasis of calm in Vegas! Everything was perfect from check in until check out. Great choice if you have children as there is a super pool (only gripe was that it closed at 8pm) and it actually has a casino where children can walk through without being frowned at (unlike others we encountered in Vegas). Also a great choice if you are a golfer - two wonderful courses on the doorstep.
reviews.title: Wonderful Marriott

reviews.text: I love Vegas and one of the reasons why is the JW Marriott in Summerlin. Always one to stay on the Strip, I heard that the Spa at the JW Marriott was excellent (and I heard this while I was at Spa Mandalay, which I think is also an excellent Spa.) So my friends and I decided to stay at the JW Marriott to check it out. Both the Spa and the Resort itself were incredible. Spa first: excellent fitness facilties, fitness classes, treatments and lounge area. I had a body scrub and a clarifying facial and both were wonderful. Hotel and rooms: Who needs the Spa when the hotel room's bathroom has a large whirlpool jet tub in it, as well as a rainfall showerhead in the separately enclosed shower!!! FABULOUS!!! Bedding was soft and comfortable; room was nicely appointed, and yes...the bathroom is DIVINE! The hotel staff were always friendly, always professional, and always "At Your Service" when you needed extra anything (towels, robes, etc.) I was quite impressed when I received a follow-up call in my hotel room to make sure that my requests were met. There is also a casino so you really don't need to go anywhere else! AND, if you enjoy golf, there are plenty of beautiful, world-class golf courses surrounding the JW Marriott. Top-notch customer service will always win out, when you have so many comparable, hotels and resorts in one area. That's why the JW Marriott in Summerlin stands out as a class act from others. I stayed at THEHotel at Mandalay Bay the following day after the JW Marriott. Although the suite hotel is swank, the service at THEHotel was sub-par to the JW Marriott...no comparison! Give the JW Marriott a try...you will be glad you did.
reviews.title: It's true! JW Marriott is fabulous!

likes.liked: — Customer Service, Hotel and Room Amenties, Spa
likes.disliked: — Rent a car...it's cheaper then taking a taxi to this hotel from the airport.

reviews.title: Great resort - away from the Vegas Strip!
reviews.text: We stayed here on our way to Brian Head (UT). This is a great resort. We have stayed at many Marriott hotels, but this was even better than the "usual" Marriott themed hotels. The rooms are spacious (we had two queen beds) and the beds were very comfortable (down cover, really comfy pillows). We stayed in the "Deluxe Guest Room" which is the least expensive of all the rooms. We really liked the spacious bathrooms, and the whirlpool bath is separate from the shower. The pool area is nice - decent size pool and there are cabanas for rent. The resort is very quiet, since it's located in Summerlin, a bit west of the Vegas strip. It was perfect for us, but if you are looking for the "Vegas strip" experience, then you might not enjoy this place. We did not use the casinos, but we walked through it in the morning to go get breakfast. We are not really the "gambling" type so I did not notice much about the casinos. One thing to note: Since the resort is far from the strip, there are not too many restaurants located nearby, so we ended eating at the resort. We had purchased a "family" package which included a pizza/soda meal and a free movie selection, so the only meal we had to purchase was breakfast. The staff seemed very friendly. We would highly recommend this place to travelers, and we would stay here again.

reviews.title: Another enjoyable stay at JW Marriott
reviews.text: Every July my husband's employer schedules a conference at the JW Marriott. This is our fourth year at the resort, and every stay has been excellent. The hotel interior is beautifully decorated, and the grounds are beautifully landscaped. Everything is maintained at the highest level, and the staff is very helpful. The free shuttle to the Fashion Mall is handy, and the driver is quick to offer cold water to his riders -- very welcome in July! The only on-site restaurant we visited was the Promonade, where we took breakfast each morning. Really, the only negative about the resort is the long drive to the Strip to take in shows.

aka: Jw Marriott Las Vegas Resort, Spa And Golf
description: Luxury Las Vegas Resort Hotel located 20 minutes from the Las Vegas Strip covering 54 lushly landscaped acres in the premier golf neighborhood of Summerlin. The resort features an award-winning spa, Vegas-style casino, 8 restaurants, an 11,000 square foot waterfall pool, and a conference facility with 100,000 sq.ft. of flexible indoor/outdoor function space.
